content: snug as a bug sleep sack the snug as a bug sleep sack keeps your baby warm and comfy without the worry of blankets this sleep sack can be used with arms tucked in or as shown above with arms out for babies like mine who can t stand to have their arms tucked even at just a few weeks old pattern can be made with a sewn bottom as seen above or with a button band photos included materials needed sizes one size fits most babies from newborn through  300 yards aran weight yarn - i love this the first four months yarn 100% acrylic 355 yards/325 meters per 198 grams used in photos abbreviations  us 8 / 5 0 mm 16 circular needle  darning needle for weaving in ends co = co  stitch marker k = k  four buttons for button band version k2tog = k two stitches together p = p gauge round = round 17 sts x 22 row = 4 in stockinette sl = slip_stitch sts = stitches yo = yarn over she makes hats - http //www shemakeshats com for pattern support robyn@shemakeshats com pattern for personal use only directions using long tail method co 72 sts place marker to join being careful not to twist round 1 k 2 p 2 around repeat round 1 until sack measures 4 from co edge round 2 k all sts repeat round 2 until sack measures 18 from co edge finishing closed version bind off all sts in pattern cut yarn to 20 and sew bottom of sack together weave in all ends finishing buttoned bottom remove stitch marker and bobble 36 sts k the next 36 sts turn work you will now work the sack back and forth rather than in the round round 1-8 sl1 k to end round 9 sl1 k2 k2tog yo *k7 k2tog yo* repeat between * two moer times k4 round 10-13 sl1 k to end bind off all stitches and weave in all ends sew four buttons to sleep sack she makes hats - http //www shemakeshats com for pattern support robyn@shemakeshats com pattern for personal use only
